metadata.name: Comparative Analysis
metadata.description: Evaluates researcher agent's ability to compare and contrast multiple options

testCase.userPrompt: Compare electric vehicles vs hybrid vehicles - what are the pros and cons of each?

output.query: electric vehicles vs hybrid vehicles pros cons comparison

results.title: EV vs Hybrid: Complete Comparison Guide
results.snippet: EVs offer zero emissions and lower running costs but limited range (200-300 miles) and longer charging times. Hybrids provide better range with no charging infrastructure needs but still use gasoline.

results.title: Total Cost of Ownership: EV vs Hybrid
results.snippet: EVs have higher upfront costs but save $1,000-2,000 annually on fuel. Hybrids are cheaper initially with 40-50 MPG efficiency. Battery replacement costs are a factor for both.

requiredElements.value: provides information about both electric vehicles and hybrid vehicles

requiredElements.description: Lists pros and cons for each
requiredElements.value: identifies advantages and disadvantages of each option
mentions range, charging, emissions, or cost differences

optionalElements.value: suggests which might be better for different use cases
